page.title: 13TELECOMMUNICATIONS
page.content: BRITISH STEEL also own a radio mast at Hunshelf.British Telecom are building a mast next to the B.S. mast. It will be 59.8 metres tall and has 7 dishes the intervals between thebars us 4.6 metres. The tower is to be used for a T.V. link from Sheffield to Leeds and used for Telecommunications. It is close to Hill Top Farm Radio Station and 500 metres from Godleys farm. Fox Wire Ltd. is a wholly owned subsidiary of B.S. and was set up on 1st April 1985. It is interesting because thogh the works is 1/3 of a mile long it covers the smallest amount of space in the south west square of our block. The works employs 225 people,and produces stainless steel and alloy wire, used mainly for ball and roller bearings. 1/3 of the wire made there is exported. The origional works was set up (cont)
